name: Double quality of food
question: Would you vote for a directive that partially tightens the double quality of food issue?
description: The food with the same labels can have a different quality in different EU countries. The new directive prohibits double quality unless there are good reasons to do so. Proponents of this form of directive argued that this was a major shift, critics said it was inadequate and double quality will be still allowed.

name: Resolution - Babiš, Agrofert
question: Would you vote for a resolution on the conflict of interest of Czech Prime Minister A. Babiš?
description: Parliament voted on a resolution criticizing Czech Prime Minister A. Babiš's conflict of interest because of his attachment to the company Agrofert. The resolution, among other things, calls on the Commission to stop all subsidies for Agrofert, asks for a re-examination of all subsidies since he became Minister in 2014.

name: Punishment of Hungary
question: Would you vote to start a procedure against Hungary for violating EU fundamental values?
description: Parliament voted to launch a disciplinary action against Hungary. He blamed the Hungarian government for attacks on the media, minorities and the rule of law. The Hungarian government has rejected these allegations. If Member States also agree, Hungary could, in extreme case, even temporarily lose its voting rights.

name: Ban on single-use plastics
question: Do you agree with the banning of single-use plastics?
description: The legislation will ban single-use plastics (such as cotton buds, plastic cuttlery or straws) from 2021 in order to lower the amount of plastic waste the Europeans produce.

name: Stricter firearm control
question: Would you vote to tighten the possession of firearms?
description: Parliament voted in favor of a directive that prohibits certain weapons - such as various types of semi-automatic weapons. Some, such as alarm guns, require registration.

name: Copyright reform - changes
question: Would you vote to change proposed copyright reform to limit how copyrighted content is shared on online platform?
description: The copyright reform contains also "Article 11" and "Article 13" (renumbered to 15 and 17). Article 13 says that every uploaded content shall be directly checked for infringing copyrights. Article 11 intends to get news aggregator sites, such as Google News, to pay publishers for using snippers of their articles. The vote was to reject the proposal and allow changes in it. I.e, Yes = allow changes, No = The original proposal.

name: Emission Performance Standards for New Passenger Cars
question: Do you agree with the limits on emissions of new passenger cars?
description: The legislation sets emissions limits for all new passenger cars and light commercial vehicles. The goal is to decrease the emissions of passenger cars by 37,5% (and of vans by 31%) by 2030.

name: Restriction of monopoly on the internet - Digital Single Market
question: Do you agree with the introduction of the digital single market within the EU?
description: The European Parliament adopted a resolution calling on member states and the Commission to focus on the obstacles that hinder the development of a digital single market and try to eliminate them. The proposal should support the rights of consumers, contribute to the economic growth, and prevent an excessive market concentration and abuse of dominance on the market. This initiative of the European Parliament is also seen as a call for the European Commission to take a tougher stance against Google and its dominant position in Internet search.

name: Association agreement with Ukraine
question: Do you agree with the integration of Ukraine into European structures?
description: The European parliament passed the recommendation which gives its consent to conclusion of the Association agreement between the EU and Ukraine and instructs its President to forward its position to the Council, the Commission and the governments and parliaments of the member states and of Ukraine. The Association agreement also includes the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area which opens markets via the progressive removal of customs tariffs and quotas, and by an extensive harmonization of laws, norms and regulations in various trade-related sectors.

name: Rule of law
question: Should the EU be able to suspend EU payments to a country based on deficiencies in the rule of law?
description: If the EU Commission established that “generalised deficiencies as regards the rule of law” in an EU country threaten the state’s ability to manage EU funds, the Commission could suggest measures ranging from reducing pre-financing to suspending EU budget payments. Parliament and EU ministers would have to greenlight any decision.

name: Visa Liberalization
question: Do you agree that Kosovo citizens should be allowed to travel to the EU without visa?
description: Kosovo citizens are at this moment the only ones from the Balkans who need visa to enter the EU. The European Commission assessed Kosovo as ready for visa-free regime and recommended the European Parliament and EU Council to vote in favor of lifting the visa regime after Kosovo fulfilled all conditions identified in the Visa Liberalization Roadmap.

name: Criticism of the CIA's counter-terrorism program
question: Do you condemn the methods of CIA's counter-terrorism program?
description: Resolution was adopted in the European Parliament following the revelation of US Senate about using torture as method in CIA’s counter-terrorism program. It clearly condemns using these methods and call to member states for investigate, whether there were secret CIA prisons inside EU.

name: CFSP
question: Do you think the EU should cooperate more closely in foreign and security policy areas?
description: In the resolution on the CFSP, MEPs argued that member states should prioritise unified EU positions over national interests. Setting up of an EU Security Council and improving decision-making by replacing the unanimity requirement in the Council, where everyone has to be in agreement, with qualified majority voting (a system of weighted votes) on matters relating to the CFSP was suggested.

name: Trade
question: Do you agree with the EU pursuing a free trade agreement negotiations with the current US administration?
description: The EP has failed to approve opening of negotiations with the US on a limited free trade agreement, despite strings attached: the agreement must be focused only on tariffs on industrial goods, including cars, must exclude agriculture and is dependent on lifting of the current US aluminium and steel tariffs and no issuance of new tariffs. Nonetheless, since the EP's resolution is non-binding on Member States and the Member States approved the negotiating mandate, the EU-US trade talks will go ahead.

name: Recognition of Palestine
question: Do you agree with the creation of an independent Palestinian state?
description: The European Parliament passed a resolution that supports recognition of Palestine statehood and solution based on the existence of two independent states: Israel and Palestine.

name: Association agreement with Georgia
question: Do you agree with Georgia's integration into European structures?
description: The European parliament passed the recommendation which gives its consent to conclusion of the Association agreement between the EU and Georgia and instructs its President to forward its position to the Council, the Commission and the governments and parliaments of the member states and of Georgia. The Association agreement includes Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area which eliminate all import duties and prohibition of export duties on all goods on the EU side with exception of some agricultural goods. The estimated growth of the trade is 12% as regards Georgia’s exports to the EU, and 7.5% in the case of imports from the EU.

name: Posted-Workers Directive
question: Hlasovali byste pro to, aby pravidla pro zaměstnance vyslané do jiné země EU, se museli více řídit "cílovou" zemí?
description: Návrh úprav směrnice pro vysílání pracovníků do zahranicí mj. omezoval dobu, kdy zaměstnanec má sociální pojištění nebo mzdu dle původní země na max. 1 rok s možností prodloužení o 6 měsíců. Poté již vyslaný zaměstnanec musí např. dostávat minimální mzdu dle "cílové" země a také tam platit sociální pojištění.

name: Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF)
question: Do you agree with the European Parliament that the existing AMIF should be continued within the next Multi-Annual Financial Framework?
description: The AMIF provisions cover topics from reforming the Common European Asylum system, to optimizing return policy, to creating legal channels of migration and promoting the integration of refugees. It will provide financial support for the implementation of the asylum and migration acquis.

name: Fundamental Implications of Big Data
question: Do you agree with the European Parliament that the EU should play a proactive role in creating a framework for the application of Big Data?
description: The "on fundamental rights implications of big data: privacy, data protection, non-discrimination, security and law-enforcement"-report that was agreed upon in the European Parliament stresses that the EU needs to take a proactive role in "taming" Big Data and the technological giants collecting it, such as Facebook and Google.

name: End of strategy partnership with Russia
question: Should the EU reconsider its strategic partnership with Russia?
description: Resolution adopted in the European Parliament in relation with annexation of Crimea and military aggression in the east of Ukraine clearly describe Russia as aggressor and suggest that EU should reconsider its mutual relations. According to adopted text, Russia cannot be considered as strategic partner any more.

name: Humanitarian Visas
question: Do you agree with the European Parliament that the EU should establish the requisite legislative framework for the implementation of Humanitarian Visas?
description: The legislative framework establishing the foundation for Humanitarian Visas would address the current situation that there is in EU law no provision as to how a refugee should actually arrive, leading to a situation that almost all arrivals take place in an irregular and often life-threatening manner.

name: Limitation of production of 1st generation biofuels
question: Do you agree with the limitation of production of 1st generation biofuels?
description: European parliament decided about the limitation of 1st generation biofuels. According to adopted text, its share should be under seven percent in 2020. This should guarantee higher representation of fuels made from waste and seaweeds. MEPs argue that these new types of biofuels are better for the environment.

name: EU-Africa Development Strategy
question: Do you agree with the European Parliament that the EU should boost its development strategy with and in Africa?
description: The EU-Africa development strategy boost is intended to increase the ambitions of the EU-Africa development in areas such as economic development, good governance, security, migration, mobility, environment and human development.

name: Restrictions on GMO's
question: Do you agree with the claim that the member states themselves should have an authority to ban or restrict genetically modified organisms?
description: The European Parliament passed a resolution that increases powers of member states in respect to regulations of genetically modified organisms.

name: EU-China Relations
question: Do you agree that there is the need to maintain a level playing field with China for EU industries and defend European jobs?
description: China’s excess production capacity and the resulting cut-price exports can have a negative impact on the EU market. To adopt a market economy status, China needs to fulfill the EU's five criteria for market economy status and then Chinese exports would not be screened in anti-dumping and anti-subsidy investigations.

name: Mobility package
question: Would you support adoption of special rules for the transport sector, establishing an exception from the “equal pay for equal work” principle?
description: The new rules mean that the previously approved Posting of Workers Directive, which introduces the principle of equal pay for equal work in the same place, is not fully applicable to truck drivers. Czech drivers will thus be able to work abroad for a limited period of time without having to receive the salary of the country in which they are operating.

name: Work-life balance directive
question: Would you support a work-life balance directive which sets new or higher minimum standards for parental, paternal and carers' leave?
description: Work-life balance directive introduces at least 10 working days' paternity leave, four months of parental leave (of which two months are non-transferable and paid), five days of carers' leave a year for workers looking after seriously ill or dependent relatives and improves rights to request flexible working arrangements.

name: Border Protection - Regulation to reinforce checks at external borders
question: Do you agree with the introduction of reinforcement of checks against relevant databases at external borders?
description: The proposal introduces the checking of travel documents in various relevant databases (SLTD, SIS, and others) of both EU citizens and third-countries nationals when entering or leaving the EU.

name: Juncker investment plan
question: Would you support Juncker investment plan?
description: The plan was introduced by the president of the European Commission in November 2014. The new European fund for strategic investments will be created. It should mobilize investments of at least €315 billion in next three years.

name: European energy security strategy
question: Would you support an adoption of the European energy security strategy?
description: Last year the European Commission introduced new European energy security strategy aiming at strengthening security of European energy supplies. Main points of the strategy are completing single energy market in the EU, diversification of energy supplies, improving energy efficiency or modernization of infrastructure. The most controversial parts of the strategy are, according to some MEPs, too ambitious binding targets for energy efficiency or proposed moratorium on extraction of shale gas.

name: Capping fees for card-based payments
question: Do you agree with capping fees for card-based payments?
description: European parliament decided about capping fees for transactions made by debit cards to 0.2 % from the payed amount and to 0.3 % for transactions made by credit cards. MEPs expect annual saving amounting € 730 million on the consumer side and € 6 billion on the merchant side.

name: Cross-border exchange of information on road safety related traffic offences
question: Do you agree that member states can exchange information about the traffic offences?
description: On the basis of adopted directive about exchange of information, member states will exchange information about traffic offenses (e.g. speeding or drunk driving) so it will be easier to exact fines for traffic offences made in that country by citizens of other EU countries.

name: European prosecutor
question: Are you in favor of an establishment of the European Public Prosecutor's Office, which would monitor the use of the EU funds?
description: With regard to the low average level of charges based on the recommendations of the European Anti-Fraud Office, (only 31% of suspected cases are accusations), the European Parliament voted on the proposal for a Council regulation on the establishment on the European Public Prosecutor´s Office and adopted a resolution which supported the establishment of the European Public Prosecutor´s Office which should conduct the investigation and prosecution in cases of fraud relating to EU funds. This should be reflected in more rigorous prosecution and better recovery of funds. Critics say that this office will not be effective and result in additional costs for taxpayers.

name: Motion of censure on Juncker commission
question: Would you vote for the expression of the mistrust for the current European Commission?
description: The group of members of the European Parliament initiated a motion of censure on the European Commission under the leadership of Jean-Claude Juncker. The proposal was justified by the fact that at a time when European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker had served as Prime Minister of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg, systems of tax avoidance were created in Luxembourg which led to losses of billions of euros of potential tax revenue in other EU member states. Members of European parliament who submitted the motion of censure argue that it is unacceptable that Juncker who was Prime Minister of the country that promoted these practices is now the President of the European Commission which fights against them. The European Parliament rejected the proposal.

name: Labeling country of origin of processed meat
question: Do you agree with mandatory country of origin labelling of meat in processed foods?
description: Mandatory country of origin labelling applies for fresh meat only in the EU. However, MEPs agreed on a resolution that expand the obligation also for processed food (e.g. in sausages). Supporters of this idea argue that it will increase awareness of consumers, opponents, on the other hand, warn about the risk of increase of prices.
